meanings.definition: A gelatinous substance obtained from certain seaweeds, used as a culture medium for bacteria.
meanings.sent1: The agar in the lab helped the scientists grow bacteria for their experiment.
meanings.sent2: The agar in the petri dish provided a perfect environment for the bacteria to grow.
meanings.sent3: The bacteria threw a party in the agar, enjoying their cozy home.
meanings.sent4: The agar acted like a cozy blanket, nurturing the bacteria like a caring parent.
meanings.sent5: The agar shimmered under the microscope, revealing a bustling city of bacteria.

meanings.definition: A substance used in cooking as a thickening agent.
meanings.sent1: The chef added agar to the soup to make it thicker and more delicious.
meanings.sent2: Agar is a great alternative to gelatin for those who prefer plant-based ingredients.
meanings.sent3: The agar in the pudding made it so thick, it could stand on its own!
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like agar, thick and rich with emotion.
meanings.sent5: The agar transformed the watery mixture into a creamy, velvety dessert.

meanings.definition: A type of jelly made from agar-agar and flavored with fruit juice.
meanings.sent1: The agar jelly was a hit at the party, with its fruity flavors bursting in every bite.
meanings.sent2: Agar-agar jelly is a popular treat in many Asian countries.
meanings.sent3: The agar-agar jelly giggled as it wobbled on the plate, entertaining the guests.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like agar-agar jelly, infectious and sweet.
meanings.sent5: The agar-agar jelly sparkled under the lights, tempting everyone with its colorful display.
